Quickly scan some sql into a map and respond:

```go
	rows, err := app.pool.Query(c.Context(), sql, pgx.NamedArgs{
		"user_id": c.Locals("userId"),
	})
	if err != nil {
		return err
	}

	stuff, err := pgx.CollectRows(rows, pgx.RowToMap)
	if err != nil {
		return err
	}

	return c.JSON(fiber.Map{
		"data": stuff,
	})
```

Explain analyze a query...

1. set a list of ids in psql:

```

\set test_ids '13173, 12301, 2300, 49581, 54462, 57064, 58829, 50753, 60243, 59292, 61643, 64272, 66226, 68575, 68572, 70139, 64578, 65765, 80728, 316935, 451896, 599104, 250697, 637233, 1119290, 678815, 987589, 1751, 30244, 19608, 30203, 19603, 540592, 110195, 374407, 407679, 105351, 68606, 48084, 261499, 186517, 269130, 8176, 3232976, 165487995, 758889321, 1035717669, 2031881850, 1919612479, 1754489233, 1577544677, 229100475, 1507826479, 292065707, 73841564, 1616852002, 2146821456, 1506322538, 1838110823, 1013874578, 1866853753, 1102495393, 1927585625, 361990697, 1069368, 532523, 283750, 443489, 1122671, 470677, 1073416, 1126914, 111363, 1133113, 1218903322, 548740, 1046489, 545514, 1092016, 1103896, 1060146, 1038716, 1038712, 1038717, 1038714, 590600, 1038711, 1050651, 396214, 1077315, 402672, 691012, 452465, 1109168, 374407, 380352, 52166, 79604, 91740, 1096397, 108671, 603876, 249270, 144230, 651990, 484436, 1073137, 1017978, 443489, 769714, 1118744851, 1864905892, 1236416725, 1678498103, 2061923407, 877750269, 981750775, 1131345, 1043558, 118455, 913023863, 185787475, 593052870, 1746093313, 966677518, 1062372263, 1220575531, 995689, 1528433024, 358201, 1819415290, 729679, 266553, 18957, 479986, 440085, 983701, 811011, 977851, 497105, 733242, 118412, 296500, 454552, 349348, 349349, 1980765743, 234288171, 1901356709, 2134858952, 470681, 610078023, 526458, 1055582, 996855, 119559, 1514565733'
```

2. Replace `@my_id` with 197005
3. Replace `= ANY(@ids::int[])` with `in (:test_ids)`
4. Prepend `EXPLAIN (ANALYZE, BUFFERS)`
